message_1: What is the slope of the line passing through the points (3, 4) and (6, 10)?
message_2:
To find the slope of a line passing through two points (x1, y1) and (x2, y2), we can use the formula:

slope (m) = (y2 - y1) / (x2 - x1)

Given the points (3, 4) and (6, 10), we can plug in the values into the formula:

m = (10 - 4) / (6 - 3)
m = 6 / 3
m = 2

The slope of the line passing through the points (3, 4) and (6, 10) is 2.
